Package com.jjjwelectronics

Interface IDevice<T extends IDeviceListener>

Type Parameters:
T - The type of listeners used for this device. For a device whose class is X, its corresponding listener interface would typically be XListener.
All Known Subinterfaces:
IBarcodeScanner, IElectronicScale
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractBarcodeScanner, AbstractDevice, AbstractElectronicScale, BarcodeScanner, ElectronicScale
public interface IDevice<T extends IDeviceListener>
The abstract base type for all devices from JJJW Electronics.
Author:
JJJW Electronics LLP

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    deregister(T listener)
    Locates the indicated listener and removes it such that it will no longer be informed of events from this device.
    void
    deregisterAll()
    All listeners registered with this device are removed.
    void
    disable()
    Disables this device from receiving input and producing output.
    void
    enable()
    Enables this device for receiving input and producing output.

    isDisabled()
    Returns whether this device is currently disabled from receiving input and producing output.

    Checks whether this device is plugged-in.

  • Method Details

    • isPluggedIn

      boolean isPluggedIn()
      Checks whether this device is plugged-in. Does not require power.
      Returns:
      true if this device is plugged-in; otherwise, false.

    • isPoweredUp

      boolean isPoweredUp()
      Checks whether this device is turned on and powered up. Does not require power.
      Returns:
      true if the device is plugged in, turned on, and receiving power; otherwise, false.

    • plugIn

      void plugIn(PowerGrid grid)
      Connects this device to the indicated electrical power grid, leaving the powered-up state unchanged. No events are announced.
      Parameters:
      grid - The grid to plug into. Cannot be null.
      Throws:
      SimulationException - If the indicated grid is null.
      NoPowerException - If the grid has a power outage.

    • unplug

      void unplug()
      Disconnects this device from the electrical power grid, also turning it off. No events are announced. If the device is already unplugged, this method has no effect. Does not require power.

    • turnOn

      void turnOn()
      Attempts to turn on the power to this device. If the state actually changes, a "turned-on" event is announced; otherwise, no events are announced. If the device is unplugged, throws an InvalidStateSimulationException. Does not require power.

    • turnOff

      void turnOff()
      Attempts to turn off the power to this device. If the device is already turned off or if it is disconnected from the power grid, this method does nothing. If the state actually changes, a "turned-off" event is announced. Does not require power.

    • deregister

      boolean deregister(T listener)
      Locates the indicated listener and removes it such that it will no longer be informed of events from this device. If the listener is not currently registered with this device, calls to this method will return false, but otherwise have no effect. Does not require power.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to remove.
      Returns:
      true if the listener was found and removed, false otherwise.

    • deregisterAll

      void deregisterAll()
      All listeners registered with this device are removed. If there are none, calls to this method have no effect. Does not require power.

    • register

      void register(T listener)
      Registers the indicated listener to receive event notifications from this device. Does not require power.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to be added.
      Throws:
      NullPointerSimulationException - If the argument is null.

    • disable

      void disable()
      Disables this device from receiving input and producing output. Announces "disabled" event. Requires power.

    • enable

      void enable()
      Enables this device for receiving input and producing output. Announces "enabled" event. Requires power.

    • isDisabled

      boolean isDisabled()
      Returns whether this device is currently disabled from receiving input and producing output. Requires power.
      Returns:
      true if the device is disabled; false if the device is enabled.

    • listeners

      List<T> listeners()
      Obtains the registered listeners on this device. Does not require power.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable list of the listeners registered on this device.
